title: Mariusz Złotek
text:
Mariusz Złotek (born 26 April 1970) is a Polish former <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="referee">referee</a> from the <a href="Stalowa%20Wola">Stalowa Wola</a> district.
Refereeing career.
He started working as a referee in 1996. In the 2013–14 season, he started refereeing in the <a href="Ekstraklasa">Ekstraklasa</a>, and his first match at this level was the match between <a href="KS%20Cracovia%20%28football%29">Cracovia</a> and <a href="%C5%9Al%C4%85sk%20Wroc%C5%82aw">Śląsk Wrocław</a>, played on 2 March 2014. In total, he refereed in 144 matches of the Ekstraklasa. In 2021, he retired as a referee. The last match he ruled in Ekstraklasa was the match between <a href="Legia%20Warsaw">Legia Warsaw</a> and <a href="G%C3%B3rnik%20%C5%81%C4%99czna">Górnik Łęczna</a> on 19 September, and the last match in his career – the <a href="Polish%20Cup">Polish Cup</a> match between <a href="Stal%20Gorzyce">Stal Gorzyce</a> and <a href="Stal%20Stalowa%20Wola">Stal Stalowa Wola</a> on 28 September.
